fact: World War II began on September 1, 1939, when Germany invaded Poland.
The war lasted until September 2, 1945, making it a six-year conflict.
Over 70 million people died during World War II, making it the deadliest conflict in human history.
The Axis Powers consisted of Germany, Italy, and Japan.
The Allied Powers included the United States, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, and China.
Adolf Hitler was the leader of Nazi Germany during World War II.
The attack on Pearl Harbor by Japan on December 7, 1941, led the United States to enter the war.
The Holocaust resulted in the systematic murder of six million Jews by the Nazis.
D-Day, the Allied invasion of Normandy, occurred on June 6, 1944.
The atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in August 1945 led to Japan's surrender.
The Battle of Stalingrad (1942â€“1943) was one of the deadliest battles in history.
The United Nations was established in 1945 after the war to promote international peace.
The Blitz was a German bombing campaign against the United Kingdom in 1940 and 1941.
The Manhattan Project was the code name for the U.S. effort to develop nuclear weapons.
Anne Frank wrote her famous diary while hiding from the Nazis in Amsterdam.
The Battle of Midway in 1942 was a turning point in the Pacific Theater.
Winston Churchill was the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom during most of the war.
The Soviet Union suffered the highest number of casualties during the war.
The Nuremberg Trials prosecuted prominent leaders of Nazi Germany for war crimes.
The Maginot Line was a line of fortifications built by France to deter German invasion.
The Enigma machine was used by Germany to encode military communications.
The Tuskegee Airmen were the first African-American military aviators in the U.S. Armed Forces.
The Battle of the Bulge was the last major German offensive on the Western Front.
The term 'Blitzkrieg' means 'lightning war' and describes Germany's rapid attack strategy.
The Siege of Leningrad lasted for 872 days, causing immense suffering and loss of life.
The Bataan Death March was a forced transfer of American and Filipino prisoners by the Japanese.
The Spitfire was a famous British fighter aircraft used during the Battle of Britain.
The Yalta Conference in 1945 was a meeting between Churchill, Roosevelt, and Stalin.
The German battleship Bismarck was sunk in May 1941 by British forces.
The Warsaw Uprising in 1944 was an attempt by the Polish resistance to liberate Warsaw from German occupation.
The Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor destroyed or damaged 19 U.S. Navy ships.
The term 'VE Day' stands for Victory in Europe Day, celebrated on May 8, 1945.
The term 'VJ Day' stands for Victory over Japan Day, celebrated on August 15, 1945.
The Battle of Kursk in 1943 was the largest tank battle in history.
The Lend-Lease Act allowed the U.S. to supply military aid to Allied nations.
The German invasion of the Soviet Union was code-named Operation Barbarossa.
The Japanese city of Hiroshima was bombed on August 6, 1945.
The Japanese city of Nagasaki was bombed on August 9, 1945.
The Geneva Conventions established rules for the humane treatment of prisoners of war.
The Battle of El Alamein in 1942 marked a turning point in the North African campaign.
The term 'Kamikaze' refers to Japanese suicide pilots who attacked Allied ships.
The Potsdam Declaration outlined the terms of Japan's surrender.
The Battle of Okinawa was the largest amphibious assault in the Pacific Theater.
The German Luftwaffe was the aerial warfare branch of the Wehrmacht.
The Soviet T-34 tank was one of the most effective tanks of the war.
The Battle of Britain was fought entirely in the air.
The term 'Axis' was first used by Benito Mussolini in 1936.
The U.S. dropped over 2 million tons of bombs during the war.
The Battle of Guadalcanal was the first major Allied offensive in the Pacific.
The term 'Holocaust' comes from a Greek word meaning 'sacrifice by fire.'
The V-2 rocket was the world's first long-range guided ballistic missile.
The Battle of Dunkirk involved the evacuation of over 330,000 Allied troops.
The term 'Gestapo' refers to the Nazi secret police.
The Battle of Iwo Jima was marked by the iconic raising of the U.S. flag on Mount Suribachi.
The Atlantic Charter was a joint declaration by Roosevelt and Churchill outlining post-war goals.
The term 'Third Reich' refers to Nazi Germany under Hitler's rule.
The Battle of Leyte Gulf was the largest naval battle in history.
The term 'Resistance' refers to underground movements against Axis occupation.
The term 'Iron Curtain' was popularized by Winston Churchill to describe the division of Europe.
The Soviet Union's Red Army captured Berlin in May 1945.
The term 'Final Solution' was the Nazi plan to exterminate the Jewish population.
